result.execSummary:
The defendant Aaron J. Ebensperger was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

INCLUDES 15CF494, 15CF589, 15CF697, AND 15CF1114. 
State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo; Def appears in person, in custody with Atty Wright Laufenberg.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. VRCW. 

State moves to
In 15CF494: Ct. 1 (False Imprisonment/Repeater/DA)>>D&RI. 
                    : Ct. 2 (False Imprisonment/Repeater/DA)>>D&RI.

                    : Ct. 5 (Hit & Run/Repeater)>>D&RI.

In 15CF1114: Ct. 5 (Felony BJ/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
                      : Ct. 6 (Felony BJ/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
                      : Ct. 7 (Felony BJ/Repeater)>>D&RI.

                      : Ct. 13 (Felony BJ/Repeater)>>D&RI.  
                      : Ct. 14 (Felony BJ/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
COURT grants above. 

PLEA: 
In 15CF494: Ct. 4 (DC/Repeater/DA)>>NO CONTEST. 
                    : Ct. 5 (DC/Repeater/DA)>>NO CONTEST. 
                    : Ct. 6 (DC/Repeater/DA)>>NO CONTEST. 
In 15CF697: Ct. 1 (Operator Flee-Elude Officer - Bodily Harm/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 
                    : Ct. 2 (1st Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 
In 15CF1114: Ct. 1 (Felony BJ/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 
                      : Ct. 2 (Felony BJ/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 
                      : Ct. 3 (Felony BJ/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 
                      : Ct. 4 (Felony BJ/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 
Def makes statement. 

COURT ORDERS: 
In 15CF494: Ct. 4>>2 yrs imprisonment - 1 yr IC and 1 yr ES - with 637 days credit. 
                    : Ct. 5>>2 yrs imprisonment - 1 yr IC and 1 yr ES - with 637 days credit. 
                    : Ct. 6>>2 yrs imprisonment - 1 yr IC and 1 yr ES - with 637 days credit. 
In 15CF697: Ct. 1>>7 yrs imprisonment - 4 yrs IC and 3 yrs ES - with 744 days credit. 
                    : Ct. 2>>10 yrs imprisonment - 4 yrs IC and 6 yrs ES - with 744 days credit. 
In 15CF1114: Ct. 1>>6.5 yrs imprisonment - 3.5 yrs IC and 3 yrs ES - with 630 days credit. 
                      : Ct. 2>>6.5 yrs imprisonment - 3.5 yrs IC and 3 yrs ES - with 630 days credit. 
                      : Ct. 3>>6.5 yrs imprisonment - 3.5 yrs IC and 3 yrs ES - with 630 days credit. 
                      : Ct. 4>>6.5 yrs imprisonment - 3.5 yrs IC and 3 yrs ES - with 630 days credit. 

COURT ORDERS as CONDITIONS OF ES in ALL: AODA and follow through unless already done during confinement; sign up for and successfully complete SAFE program assessment and follow through; assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; absolute sobriety from controlled substances except prescriptions taken as prescribed and with prior agent authorization; absolute sobriety from alcohol except as allowed by agent; no contact with victim C.V.; DNA sample/surcharge (1 surcharge per numbered file); CC including 3 DA surcharges. 

COURT ORDERS as CONDITION OF ES in 15CF697: restitution of $10,506.37 to West Bend Mutual. 

COURT ORDERS sentences to run CONCURRENT to each other. 
COURT finds the def eligible for CIP and SAP. 
COURT remands def into custody of MCSD for transport to WSPS.

Case Called: 10:59 am 
INCLUDES 15CF494, 15CF697, 15CF1114, AND 15CF589. 
State appears by ADA Matt Adrian; Deft appears in person, in custody, pro se. 
Date and time set for hearing on deft's request for return of property. 
COURT questions deft re: obtaining counsel. 
Deft states he is still working towards obtaining counsel and notes if truck is returned, he should be able to hire an attorney. 
State notes truck is considered evidence. 
COURT questions if testing needs to be done. 
State notes uncertainty re: testing. 
Argument. 
COURT authorizes release of vehicle to bona fide purchaser. 
COURT directs deft to inquire re: storage fees. 
Deft requests return of other property. 
State makes statement. 
COURT directs State to make an inventory of items that are related to pending charges as stated on the record.

records.addlTxt: INCLUDES 15CF494, 15CF589, 15CF1114 & 15CF697 No contact with victim(s): C.V.-NON WAIVABLE. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney. Police escort to retrieve any personal belongings. Shall not drive a motor vehicle without valid driver's license.
